Package ntnu.idatt2106.group8.gidd.controller

Class AccountController

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt2106.group8.gidd.controller.AccountController
@CrossOrigin(origins="*",
             allowedHeaders="*")
@RestController
public class AccountController
extends java.lang.Object
A controller class handling requests from client regarding accounts. Most important is POST to "/accounts" and POST "/accounts/login". This is where users register accounts and get JWT token when successfully logging in.

      @GetMapping("accounts/{email}") public Account getAccountByEmail​(@PathVariable java.lang.String email)
      GetMapping for finding an Account with a specific email
      Parameters:
      email - PathVariable of the email of the Account
      Returns:
      the Account with this email

    • getAllAccounts

      @GetMapping("accounts/") public java.util.List<Account> getAllAccounts()
      GetMapping for getting all registered Accounts
      Returns:
      a list of all registered Accounts

    • saveUser

      @PostMapping("accounts/register") public boolean saveUser​(@RequestBody Account account)
      PostMapping for saving a new Account to the database
      Parameters:
      account - requesting the body of the Account to save
      Returns:
      true or false whether the user was created successfully or not

    • login

      @PostMapping("accounts/login") public JWTResponse login​(@RequestBody AuthRequest authRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws java.lang.Exception
      Important method that is necessary to authenticate a user login and generate a JWT token if the login is successful. This token can then be included in further HTTP requests from client to access other methods and identify user by email
      Parameters:
      authRequest - requesting the body of an AuthRequest
      Returns:
      JWT token if successful
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - exception

    • isValidToken

      @PostMapping("accounts/validateToken") public boolean isValidToken​(@RequestBody JWTResponse jwtResponse)
      PostMapping for validating token
      Parameters:
      jwtResponse - requesting the body of a JWTResponse
      Returns:
      true or false whether the token was valid or not
